page.title: 14LLANSTEFFAN AREA: TRANSPORT
page.content: Public transport is inadequate. One bus plies 4 times daily between both villages and Carmarthen, but not on Sundays or in the evenings. It does not serve the outlying houses. School buses (not available to the general public) take children to and from school. To catch trains and long distance coaches we have to go to Carmarthen. Thus to the majority of people a car is a necessity but not all can afford one. A small minority have motorbikes or bicycles. A limited "country cars" service is being started up by the WRVS, operated by volunteer car-owners and financed by Dyfed County Council. The District Council gives free bus tokens or cash in lieu to pensioners. Only one garage sells petrol locally (it is outside the present "block", at Waunygroes near Llanybri.
